meanings.definition: The act of inflicting serious damage on something
meanings.sent1: The mutilation of the ancient statue left it in pieces.
meanings.sent2: The mutilation of the forest by the storm was devastating.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef's attempt at cooking was a mutilation of the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's spray paint was a colorful mutilation of the blank wall.
meanings.sent5: The car accident resulted in a brutal mutilation of the vehicle.

meanings.definition: The act of disfiguring or destroying a part of the body
meanings.sent1: The mutilation of the doll's face made it unrecognizable.
meanings.sent2: The self-inflicted mutilation on his arm was a cry for help.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt at cutting his own hair was a comical mutilation.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire's path through the forest was a natural mutilation of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins showed signs of intentional mutilation by vandals.
